title: Fort Smith National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Discover the Past  From the establishment of the first Fort Smith on December 25, 1817, to the final days of Judge Isaac C. Parker's jurisdiction over Indian Territory in 1896, Fort Smith National Historic Site preserves almost 80 years of history. Explore life on the edge of Indian Territory through the stories of soldiers, the Trail of Tears, dangerous outlaws, and the brave lawmen who pursued them.              Exploring Fort Smith   Jails, courtroom, trails, exhibits, and more there are many ways to explore Fort Smith.            Become a Junior Ranger   Kids of all ages can earn Junior Ranger badges.        Volunteers wanted   We have opportunities for those wishing to volunteer their time and skills. Become a VIP - Volunteers in Parks              Park Passes   A pass cover entrance fees and day use fees at over 2,000 federal recreation sites.        Executions at Fort Smith   From 1873 - 1896, eighty-six men were hanged for the crimes of murder and rape.        Federal Court 1872-1896 Database   Searchable database of Deputy US Marshals and Federal Court Employees   for the Western District of Arkansas including I.T. 1872 -1896.
